error.signature: TS7006: Parameter 'x' implicitly has an 'any' type
error.regex: TS7006: Parameter ['\"]?(.+?)['\"]? implicitly has an ['\"]any['\"] type

verdict.summary: TypeScript strict mode requires explicit types. Very common when enabling strict for the first time.

dead_ends.why_fails: Loses all the safety benefits of TypeScript strict mode
Removes type safety, making TypeScript equivalent to JavaScript

workarounds.action: Add proper type annotations to function parameters
Use type inference where possible (let TypeScript infer from usage)

leads_to.condition: Adding types reveals existing type mismatches
Adding parameter types reveals argument mismatches

preceded_by.condition: Fixing argument errors leads to enabling stricter settings

frequently_confused_with.distinction: TS2345 is about wrong argument types; TS7006 is about missing type annotations entirely
